ranked_differential_diagnosis.label: Auditory Nerve Involvement (Charcot-Marie-Tooth Syndrome)
ranked_differential_diagnosis.rationale_short: Supported by absent ABRs, significant speech rollover, and reflex decay despite mild hearing loss, consistent with neural dys-synchrony confirmed by CMT diagnosis.

ranked_differential_diagnosis.label: Brainstem Lesion
ranked_differential_diagnosis.rationale_short: Considered due to abnormal central behavioral tests and ABR patterns, but radiologic findings were unremarkable.

ranked_differential_diagnosis.label: Acoustic Neuroma
ranked_differential_diagnosis.rationale_short: Initial suspicion due to retrocochlear signs (rollover, decay), but ruled out by normal radiologic findings.

ordered_list.rationale_short: To assess recognition abilities and check for rollover at high intensities.
To screen for retrocochlear pathology via reflex thresholds and decay.
To evaluate neural integrity given disproportionate speech difficulties.
To assess central auditory processing capabilities.

expected_interpretations_by_visit.collective_interpretation: Audiological evaluation revealed mild sensorineural hearing loss with disproportionately poor speech recognition in noise and at high intensities (rollover). Objective measures showed excessive acoustic reflex decay and absent ABRs, strongly suggesting retrocochlear or neural dysfunction rather than cochlear pathology.

tests.name: Pure-tone audiometry
tests.result_summary: Mild pure tone hearing loss bilaterally; thresholds generally in the 20-50 dB HL range.

tests.name: Speech audiometry
tests.result_summary: Excellent recognition at low levels (92% bilaterally) but significant rollover at high intensities (RE 44%, LE 48% at +50 dB SL).

tests.name: Acoustic reflexes
tests.result_summary: Reflexes present at some frequencies but absent at high frequencies; excessive reflex decay (90-100%) present bilaterally.

tests.name: Auditory Brainstem Response (ABR)
tests.result_summary: No repeatable response for either ear.

tests.name: Other
tests.result_summary: Abnormal performance on digits, competing sentences, SSW, frequency patterns, and filtered speech; abnormal binaural MLD (5 dB).

expected_interpretations_by_visit.collective_interpretation: Medical workup ruled out space-occupying lesions but confirmed a systemic peripheral neuropathy affecting the auditory nerve.

tests.name: Other
tests.result_summary: Radiologic findings unremarkable; neurologic workup and EMG confirmed Charcot-Marie-Tooth (CMT) syndrome.

counseling_actions: Explain that hearing difficulty is due to neural dys-synchrony (clarity loss) rather than sensitivity loss
Discuss why standard hearing aids were unsuccessful due to amplification of distorted signals
Counsel on the nature of Charcot-Marie-Tooth syndrome and its effect on the auditory system
Discuss environmental modifications to reduce background noise

red_flags_present: Absent ABRs despite preserved pure-tone thresholds

escalation.rationale_short: Referral for radiologic and neurologic workup to investigate retrocochlear pathology and confirm suspected neuropathy.

follow_up_plan.objective: Monitor progression of auditory symptoms and functional communication status.

expected_outcome: Auditory symptoms progressed only slightly over many years of follow-up.
Audiological findings remained similar to initial evaluation.
FM assistive listening device provided the patient with some assistance.
Patient changed job to one that was not as auditorily demanding.
Patient continues to have considerable difficulty hearing in less than ideal acoustic environments.
